question: Question_05_(a)
statement:
You are given a set of 100 data points \emph{(x\textsubscript{n},
y\textsubscript{n})} with \emph{x\textsubscript{n}} increasing.

\textbf{(a)} Suppose you wish to use Lagrange interpolation to
interpolate the data points. What degree of polynomial would you use and
why?
sols:
When using Lagrange interpolation, we choose to fit the point with a
polynomial of lowest degree that goes through all the points.

We have 100 points, meaning that we need a 99 degree polynomial:

$p(x)=a_1x^{99}+a_2x^{98}+...+a_{99}x+a_{100}$
